title: Mob rule
summary: Mob rule or ochlocracy (Greek: ὀχλοκρατία, romanized: okhlokratía;  Latin: ochlocratia) is the rule of government by a mob or mass of people and the intimidation of legitimate authorities. Insofar as it represents a pejorative for majoritarianism, it is akin to the Latin phrase mobile vulgus, meaning "the fickle crowd", from which the English term "mob" originally was derived in the 1680s.
